sn1.35:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
sn1.35:1.2: Then, late at night, several glorious deities of the Disdainful Group, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to the Buddha, and stood in the air.
sn1.35:1.3: Standing in the air, one deity recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.35:2.2: to be other than they really are,
sn1.35:2.4: who enjoys what was gained by theft.
sn1.35:3.1: You should only say what you would do;
sn1.35:3.2: you shouldn’t say what you wouldn’t do.
sn1.35:4.5: by which wise ones practicing absorption
sn1.35:5.1: The wise certainly don’t act like that,
sn1.35:5.2: for they understand the way of the world.
sn1.35:5.3: The wise are extinguished by understanding,
sn1.35:5.4: they’ve crossed over clinging to the world.”
sn1.35:6.1: Then those deities landed on the ground, bowed with their heads at the Buddha’s feet and said,
sn1.35:6.2: “We have made a mistake, sir. It was foolish, stupid, and unskillful of us to imagine we could attack the Buddha!
sn1.35:6.3: Please, sir, accept our mistake for what it is, so we will restrain ourselves in future.”
sn1.35:6.5: Then those deities, becoming even more disdainful, flew up in the air.
sn1.35:6.6: One deity recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.35:7.3: with hidden anger and heavy hate,
sn1.35:8.4: then who could have been unskillful?”
sn1.35:9.4: Who is the wise one that’s ever mindful?”
sn1.35:10.4: and that’s who doesn’t go astray.
sn1.35:10.6: for he’s the wise one, ever mindful.
sn1.35:11.1: If you don’t give your pardon
sn1.35:11.3: with hidden anger and heavy hate,
sn1.35:11.5: I don’t approve of such enmity,
sn1.35:11.6: and so I pardon your mistake.”
